---
title: "First Week Checklist"
---

A detailed checklist for your first week in the lab.

## Administrative (Day 1)

- [ ] Complete HR onboarding paperwork
- [ ] Get building/office access
- [ ] Obtain Onyen and UNC credentials
- [ ] Set up UNC email
- [ ] Get added to lab mailing list

## Computing Setup (Days 1-2)

- [ ] Install R (≥4.3.0) and RStudio
- [ ] Install Git and configure credentials
- [ ] Set up GitHub SSH keys
- [ ] Request Longleaf cluster access
- [ ] Install Quarto
- [ ] Join lab GitHub organization

## Communication (Day 2)

- [ ] Join lab Teams workspace
- [ ] Subscribe to relevant channels:
  - `#general` - Announcements
  - `#computing` - Technical help
  - `#papers` - Literature discussion
  - `#random` - Social
- [ ] Add lab meeting to calendar

## Orientation (Days 3-4)

- [ ] Meet with Dr. Rashid (1:1)
- [ ] Get overview of current lab projects
- [ ] Receive reading list (2-3 key papers)
- [ ] Identify project mentor
- [ ] Attend lab meeting

## First Code (Day 5)

- [ ] Clone template repository
- [ ] Install project dependencies (`install.packages(c("targets", "data.table", "here"))  # Install core packages`)
- [ ] Run example pipeline (`targets::tar_make()`)
- [ ] Make a small change
- [ ] Commit and push

## Documentation to Read

1. [Coding Standards](../coding-standards/index.qmd) - Lab code style
2. [Targets Pipeline Guide](../coding-standards/targets-pipeline.qmd) - Workflow management
3. [Project Consistency](../project-consistency/index.qmd) - Keeping code/docs aligned

## Questions to Ask

In your first meeting with Dr. Rashid:

1. What project will I be working on?
2. Who is my day-to-day mentor?
3. What are the short-term and long-term goals?
4. What background reading should I prioritize?
5. When is my first presentation expected?

## End of Week 1 Goals

By Friday, you should be able to:

- ✅ Log into Longleaf and submit a test job
- ✅ Clone, modify, and push to a GitHub repo
- ✅ Run a `targets` pipeline locally
- ✅ Render a Quarto document to PDF
- ✅ Know who to ask for different types of help
